alert.note: Alert for Crittenden; Cross; Poinsett (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 3:08AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Poinsett, northwestern Crittenden and Cross Counties through 400 AM CDT... At 307 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hickory Ridge, or 17 miles northwest of Wynne, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wynne, Earle, Parkin, Cherry Valley, Crawfordsville, Hickory Ridge, Vanndale, Fisher, Smithdale, Three Forks, Hydrick, Wiley Crossing, Birdeye, Deckerville, Supply, Stewart, Colton, Twist, McDonald and Brushy Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
